reviews.title: Comparison
reviews.text: This review is a little different since I have never stayed at the property in question. I live in the small town of Millington and had occasion to tour the Admiralty a while back. First I will state that I am not friends with anyone at Admiralty. My husband and I travel a lot and I compare. We usually stay at Hampton and Drury Inns. I can assure you that The Admiralty is just as nice as any motel we have stayed. I don't think anyone will be disappointed. The day I was there they had the Continental breakfast out and it looked delicious.

reviews.title: Local owner
reviews.text: We like staying with them. My husband has been working in Millington and these rooms are now like our home away from home. The employees are all great. On several occasions my husband has been late calling me at home when he gets off work, the staff went outside to see if his truck was there. We like giving our money to an American owned establishment.

The rooms are very basic - pretty much get what you pay for. They provided a roll away bed as requested - but no bed linen for it! The blankets on the beds appeared to have been cut from one large piece of material - as the edges were jagged!!!! The sheets on the queen bed seemed to be for a full bed - as they barely reached the edge of the bed. The pillows were terrible! However, the room seemed very clean in general.
reviews.title: Adequate for the price

reviews.text: If you are looking for a cheap
reviews.title: Not horrible, but number 1 ranked?

reviews.text: First the bad to get it out of the way early:
reviews.title: what a wonderful stay at admiralty suites and inn

reviews.text: - the remote control in one bedroom had no batteries
reviews.title: Couldn't have been more pleased with our stay.

reviews.text: - the roll away bed was thoughtfully there for us, but no sheets and it would have required a lengthy haul back to get them
reviews.title: Awsome place to stay

reviews.text: This is an awesome place to stay! The staff is SO friendly; great service with a smile.
reviews.title: An awesome place to stay!

reviews.text: Clean, comfortable rooms with a full kitchen... and I'm 6'8" and loved the beds!
reviews.title: The staff is incredible and extremely accommodating.

reviews.text: Just a short scenic drive to all the fun in Memphis! A great hotel, wonderful breakfast with fruit, biscuits, gravy. A super value!
reviews.title: My true home away from home

reviews.text: The entire staff was incredibly polite and gracious during our group's stay. Our visit was during an extreme heat wave. When the hotel's ice machine could not produce enough ice to keep up with demand, the management went out and bought ice for the patrons. They worked around our boys' tournament schedule to clean rooms, provide extra towels, and allow us all a late check-out so the boys could shower after their final game. We experienced true Southern hospitality!
reviews.title: Nice stay for a great price
We will never stay here again
reviews.text: If it had not been for the very nice, clean, and display of flags we would have continued down highway 51 north to the Hoilday Inn. What a blessing it was to stay at your place of business. The very moment we entered the lobby we were greeted by a very pleasant and beaming smile from Miss Elizabeth. This young lady made us feel at home and full-filled our every and we mean every need. She deserves a pat on the back and a raise.
